intro: Leavenworthia torulosa, commonly known as the prairie salsify, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of thick, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and wetland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies.
